answers.answer: It can be dangerous to your body to have babies too close together. It can increase your risk of preeclampsia,  gestational diabetes, uterine prolapse,  and other issues - it can also raise the risk of preterm labor and low birth weight in your second baby. These things aren't guaranteed to happen - but the risk factors go way up if you don't wait at least 12-18 months before ttc again.I totally get that your hormones are going WILD right now. Give yourself and your husband a chance to get into a routine, love up on the baby you've just had. Your body needs time to recover. Take your time.Congratulations on your new baby!

question: I just had my daughter 8 days ago. My husband and I knew we would want 3 or more children, but with this one being out first we figured we would wait until she was 2 or 3 to have another baby. Now that she is here, we desperately want another! She is such a good baby so far and I would love to have another one close in age. We are thinking about trying again in a couple of months.
